row_list: Weblinks to online language resources as an example dataset for the TOMLA Weblinks menu.
This is a NL-F-En multimedia cheat sheet to test multi-line datacells and most TOMLA functionality.
All rights reserved! This dataset is not intended for free reuse! For TOMLA testing purposes only!

No = No download key from publisher required; Yes = User needs download key from publisher.
When set to Yes the download website will check for a valid download key in the dataset weblink.
This means with ‘Yes’ the dataset download is protected so the publisher can control the use.
Ask the Publisher for a download key for manual input in TOMLA or for a weblink with the key in it.
The weblink can be provided by the Publisher as a user friendly QR-code for fast input in TOMLA.

File name of trailer video file which must be in the Trailer subfolder of the dataset.
This is an 8 second clip of Oudeschild harbor on Texel island (NL) from 20180125.
Weblink to video file on a website. This link shows the funny Big Buck Bunny demo video from Blender.

The font from the font file in the Font_Column-name field is used to display the content of that column.
Fonts must be in the WOFF2 file format and they must be in the Fonts subfolder of the dataset.
Default Ubuntu Linux font Chilanka-Regular.ttf converted with: https://everythingfonts.com/ttf-to-woff2
Default Ubuntu Linux font Purisa.ttf converted with: https://everythingfonts.com/ttf-to-woff2
TOMLA Demo Cheat Sheet Download Key
This is the same dataset as the Demo Cheat Sheet but now with the field ‘Download key’ set to ‘Yes’!
This is a NL-F-En multimedia cheat sheet to test multi-line datacells and most TOMLA functionality.

No = No download key from publisher required; Yes = User needs download key from publisher.

Carnival aliases for many Dutch towns

A long list of official Dutch place names of villages and cities and their alias names  during carnival.
This is an example dataset for TOMLA with Open Content from Wikipedia.
Carnival aliases for many Dutch towns

A long list of official Dutch place names of villages and cities and their alias names  during carnival.
This is an example dataset for TOMLA with Open Content from Wikipedia.
Dutch words and their meaning as Open Content CSV export file from Wiktionary.
Officiele Spellingcontrolelijst Nederlands met aanvullende nog ongekeurde spellinglijsten.
Overheidsgoedkeuring: Keurmerk Spelling van de TaalUnie als uitgave: Editie zomer 2011
Vermelding publicatiedatum op website Stichting OpenTaal: 20161130
Labels: G = Gekeurd TaalUnie, O = Ongekeurd, F = Flexievorm, V = Verwarrend
